item.title: Crackdown on university cheaters
item.description: If you watched Suits, you’d know Mike Ross made some decent money taking exams that weren’t his to take.

item.title: Cops seize conspiracist’s samurai swords
item.description: Five samurai swords have allegedly been found at the house of a Melbourne conspiracy theorist dramatically arrested on Friday morning over inciting an illegal protest.

item.title: Pete Evans spruiks antivirus protest
item.description: Celebrity chef Pete Evans has joined anti-lockdown advocates in a Freedom Day rally promotional video, encouraging people to flout coronavirus restrictions on Saturday.

item.title: Alleged rape victim ‘waged war’: court
item.description: A would-be Olympic equestrian rider and his girlfriend allegedly stalked and harassed a woman who accused the man of rape in a case that resembles a “soap opera”, a court has heard.

item.title: 100kg of meth seized from drug lab
item.description: The discovery of a large Melbourne drug lab, containing 100kg of liquid methamphetamine, has led to three men being arrested and charged with drug offences.

item.title: Dramatic cocaine plane crash twist
item.description: Two alleged international drug smugglers were involved in a plot to import half a tonne of cocaine into Australia before the light plane spectacularly crashed in Papua New Guinea, police say.

item.title: Sydney trio sentenced for $80m coke plot
item.description: Life in the fast lane is officially over for three Sydney party boys, who were on Friday sentenced to years behind bars for their roles in an international cocaine plot worth $80 million.

item.title: Sydney latte-sippers have ‘no clue’: WA
item.description: West Australian Premier Mark McGowan has taken a swipe at Sydney commentators who have criticised his hard border stance, describing them as latte sippers with no clue about the state’s economy.

item.title: ‘I feel horrible’: Virus blow on Father’s Day
item.description: People in some parts of NSW have been told they cannot visit their dads in aged care this Father’s Day because the CBD cluster is still being brought under control.

item.title: Westpac delivers blow to savers
item.description: Westpac savers have been dealt a financial blow with the major bank slashing the savings rates on several of its deposit accounts.
